page.title: 15MOTTRAM - Ecology contd.
page.content: Im 1969, in one whole day, Jubilee Wood was planted , by hand, by 400 Tameside children, and contains a variety of natural species. The activities of the amenity society were taken over by Longendale Heritage Trust in 1982. The Trust continues to complete the work and has added a further planting of 7 acres, adjoining Coal Rd., called Adams Wood and consists mainly of oak, with some ash, holly, birch and cherry. Creating this tree cover has increased the presence of plant and animal life and secured a constitution of the tree -scape feature of the valley.
